newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent retraces losses on technical rebound.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent retraces losses on technical rebound.

text.p: IPE Brent retraced losses on Friday to touch a new high as NYMEX crude and gasoline reversed losses to lead a modest technical rally, brokers said.
"It's really on technicals," a dealer said. "The market tried to sell off but people thought it should move up, and a then a bit of short-covering came in."
April Brent was trading 24 cents higher at a session high of $19.94 a barrel at 1616 GMT. Next resistance was seen at the psychologically important $20 level.
"It's a battle between the shorts and the longs and the longs came out on top," said one broker.

IPE gas oil extended earlier gains made on the back of forecasts of cooler temperatures in the U.S. Northeast this weekend, which in turn boosted NYMEX heating oil. The March gas oil contract was trading $3 a tonne up at $167.50 at 1621 GMT, just below resistance at $167.75 a tonne.
